content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idea to check list of food.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good one !

Good clash idea, that I had almost approved until I thought about the reverse mode proposal with it. I do not feel it would lead to a good reverse mode experience under the current test sets, and for that I believe it may be better to have the list of food items in customer basket at the starting line (instead of last line) followed by violating combination counts, and the combinations following it. Still, I'm not very comfortable to see reverse mode working well with the case, so I invite you and fellow CodinGamers to give reverse mode improvement a thought for this problem before it gets accepted.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool Concept!

It would be funny to make it sort of like a 'high end' supermarket - and you are tasked with coding a robot waiter that checks for unspeakable food combinations.

Might make the introduction easier to understand. Like so:

You are in charge of coding an arrogant robot that will check customer's basket before they leave a high-end supermarket.

The supermarket wants you to make sure that no customer will use their superior ingredients for ridiculous food.

Get cracking and stop those criminals from putting pineapple on pizza!

Cool clash - but I was very confused when I tried to solve it.

I think the problem is that you have 'pineapple pizza' in the first example.

I assumed that 'pineapple pizza' was one item, because that's a thing, but this game wants you to think it's actually two items. In addition to that it was also confusing that they were next to each other in both the basket and in the 'forbidden items list'.

I think you can solve this by making it more obvious that it's not a single item. For example changing first example to:
1
pizza icecream
icecream sausage pizza lemon

There is a spelling mistake in the Statement.
cutsomer's instead of customer's.

Hey Panpoon,

this is a nice one!

It's not that complicated and presented with a good, comprehensible plot. Anyways due to different modes (shortest, fastest, ...) it has room for optimization (especially for shortest attempt).

Enjoyed this one and would be nice to see more clashs from you :)

Output section
* You may remove the quotation marks for the possible answers.

Binary output issue
* As per contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes. Would you please revise the output requirement so that there are more than 2 possible answers in total for all the cases (i.e. not just "CALL SECURITY" or "ALL GOOD")?

Thanks.
I'll correct those when I get the time, thanks for the feedback :)

Hey k04200420 :)

Thank you for your kind words, I really appreciate it and it definitely pushes me to write more clashes in the future !
Thank you very much DrBrask, I've corrected it :)

I find it very interesting to read your feedback, thank you. Would you think it is enough to just reverse the "pizza" and "pineapple" order in the example instead of changing the forbidden combination to pizza and icecream ? I'd like to keep "pineapple pizza" since it is maybe the most widely known gastronomical absurdity.

I was indeed thinking of a funny way to introduce the concept, and I like your idea. However, since this is a clash and people are expected to be fast, I'm not sure giving a long introduction that either people will skip or will lose time reading is a good approach, hence the one-sentence introduction I ended up writing.
Thank you very much :)
Yep, it is impossible to be understood in reverse mode
I kinda agree with you both, I just think it may not be suited for reverse mode. I'll remove it from the list.
Ah that's a good point.
Yeah I get your point. Maybe that's okay, so it becomes 'pizza pineapple'?
Exactly :) I'll do that
